column17: DB_Info
column18: KP_Info

column17: If the upper or the lower alarm limit values are exceeded, a timer function will commence.  The alarm will not become active until the set time delay has been passed.
column18: If the upper or the lower alarm limit values are exceeded, a timer function will commence.  The alarm will not become active until the set time delay has been passed.

column17: This time delay is used during start-up, during defrost, during pull-down. There will be change-over to the normal alarm time delay “A03” when the temperature falls within the alarm limits
column18: This time delay is used during start-up, during defrost, during pull-down. There will be change-over to the normal alarm time delay “A03” when the temperature falls within the alarm limits

column17: If the cabinet temperature stays above this limit for the time mentioned by the alarm delay, high temperature alarm is raised.
column18: If the cabinet temperature stays above this limit for the time mentioned by the alarm delay, high temperature alarm is raised.

column17: If the cabinet temperature stays below this limit for the time mentioned by the alarm delay, low temperature alarm is raised.
column18: If the cabinet temperature stays below this limit for the time mentioned by the alarm delay, low temperature alarm is raised.

column17: If “DI1” is configured as a door open alarm or as an external alarm, this delay is used to raise the respective alarm.
column18: If “DI1” is configured as a door open alarm or as an external alarm, this delay is used to raise the respective alarm.

column17: This parameter is to enable and disable the voltage protection feature, which protects compressor from adverse line voltage conditions.
column18: This parameter is to enable and disable the voltage protection feature, which protects compressor from adverse line voltage conditions.

column17: When the compressor is due to start, the voltage of the power supply will be checked and the compressor will only be allowed to start if it is at least the value given in this parameter.
column18: When the compressor is due to start, the voltage of the power supply will be checked and the compressor will only be allowed to start if it is at least the value given in this parameter.

column17: When the compressor is running, it will be switched OFF if the voltage goes below that given in this parameter.
column18: When the compressor is running, it will be switched OFF if the voltage goes below that given in this parameter.

column17:
When the compressor is running, it will be switched OFF if the voltage exceeds that given in this parameter.
If the compressor is already stopped, it will remain switched OFF.
column18:
When the compressor is running, it will be switched OFF if the voltage exceeds that given in this parameter.
If the compressor is already stopped, it will remain switched OFF.

column17: This parameter determines the minimum number of minutes the compressor must run before a cut-out can take effect based on temperature. This is to avoid sudden switching ON and OFF of the compressor.
column18: This parameter determines the minimum number of minutes the compressor must run before a cut-out can take effect based on temperature. This is to avoid sudden switching ON and OFF of the compressor.

column17: This parameter determines the minimum number of minutes the compressor must switched OFF before a cut-in can take effect based on temperature. This is to avoid sudden switching OFF and ON of the compressor.
column18: This parameter determines the minimum number of minutes the compressor must switched OFF before a cut-in can take effect based on temperature. This is to avoid sudden switching OFF and ON of the compressor.

column1: Comp OFF delay at open door
column17: This parameter sets the delay in minutes before the compressor stops when the door is opened. If set to zero, the function is disabled.
column18: This parameter sets the delay in minutes before the compressor stops when the door is opened. If set to zero, the function is disabled.

column17: This feature will increase the relay life time, reduce the contact welding and switching noise by switching ON at Zero crossing. Disable zero crossing when external relay is used.
column18: This feature will increase the relay life time, reduce the contact welding and switching noise by switching ON at Zero crossing. Disable zero crossing when external relay is used.

column17:
This parameter is for defining type of temperature sensors connected to the controller.
"n5" NTC 5K
"n10" NTC10K 
"ptc" PTC
"pt1"PT1000
column18:
This parameter is for defining type of temperature sensors connected to the controller.
"n5" NTC 5K
"n10" NTC10K 
"ptc" PTC
"pt1"PT1000

column17:
This parameter defines the desired cabinet temperature at which compressor cuts out.
The set value can be locked or limited to a range with the settings in “r02” and “r03”.
column18:
This parameter defines the desired cabinet temperature at which compressor cuts out.
The set value can be locked or limited to a range with the settings in “r02” and “r03”.

column17:
This defines the difference between the cut-out and the cut-in of compressor relay.
Compressor relay will cut-in when the cabinet temperature reaches the set point+differetial.
In case of heating application, heater will cut-in when the temperature reaches the set point-differential.
column18:
This defines the difference between the cut-out and the cut-in of compressor relay.
Compressor relay will cut-in when the cabinet temperature reaches the set point+differetial.
In case of heating application, heater will cut-in when the temperature reaches the set point-differential.

column17: The minimum allowable setpoint value can be configured here to avoid setting too low values by accident/mistake.
column18: The minimum allowable setpoint value can be configured here to avoid setting too low values by accident/mistake.

column17: The maximum allowable setpoint value can be configured here to avoid setting too high values by accident/mistake.
column18: The maximum allowable setpoint value can be configured here to avoid setting too high values by accident/mistake.

column17: Correction value in display temperature. If the temperature at the products and the temperature received by the controller are not identical, an offset adjustment of the display temperature can be carried out under this menu code.
column18: Correction value in display temperature. If the temperature at the products and the temperature received by the controller are not identical, an offset adjustment of the display temperature can be carried out under this menu code.

column17: Set here if the controller is to show temperature values in °C or in °F. Switching from one to the other will cause all temperature settings to be automatically updated to respective unit.
column18: Set here if the controller is to show temperature values in °C or in °F. Switching from one to the other will cause all temperature settings to be automatically updated to respective unit.

column17:
Offset for air temperature calibration.
Compensation possibility due to long sensor cable.
column18:
Offset for air temperature calibration.
Compensation possibility due to long sensor cable.

column17:
The thermostat’s reference will be the setpoint plus this value when the controller changes over to night operation. (Select a negative value if there is to be cold accumulation).
Activation can take place via digital input.
column18:
The thermostat’s reference will be the setpoint plus this value when the controller changes over to night operation. (Select a negative value if there is to be cold accumulation).
Activation can take place via digital input.

column17: The thermostat reference and the alarm values are shifted the following number of degrees when the reference displacement is activated. Activation can take place via digital input.
column18: The thermostat reference and the alarm values are shifted the following number of degrees when the reference displacement is activated. Activation can take place via digital input.

column17: After start-up the controller functions can be delayed by the time delay defined here so that overloading of the electricity supply network is avoided.
column18: After start-up the controller functions can be delayed by the time delay defined here so that overloading of the electricity supply network is avoided.

column17:
Here you can configure the DI1 to one of the functions listed below.
"oFF" not used
"Sdc" status display output
"doo" door alarm with resumption (door function)
"doA" door alarm without resumption (door alarm)
"SCH" main switch
"nig" day/night mode
"rFd"reference displacement.
"EAL" external alarm
"dEF" defrost
"Pud" pull down
"Sc" condenser sensor
column18:
Here you can configure the DI1 to one of the functions listed below.
"oFF" not used
"Sdc" status display output
"doo" door alarm with resumption (door function)
"doA" door alarm without resumption (door alarm)
"SCH" main switch
"nig" day/night mode
"rFd"reference displacement.
"EAL" external alarm
"dEF" defrost
"Pud" pull down
"Sc" condenser sensor

column17: Data communication is possible through external TTL to RS485 gateway.
column18: Data communication is possible through external TTL to RS485 gateway.

column17: If the settings in the controller are to be protected with an access code you can set a numerical value between 0 and 999. You can cancel the function by setting to 0.
column18: If the settings in the controller are to be protected with an access code you can set a numerical value between 0 and 999. You can cancel the function by setting to 0.

column17: This parameter defines the steps in which the temperature must be displayed by 0.1 or 0.5 or 1.
column18: This parameter defines the steps in which the temperature must be displayed by 0.1 or 0.5 or 1.

column17:
This parameter when set to YES. The current controller Parameter settings are stored as Factory default.
WARNING: original factory settings are overwritten.
column18:
This parameter when set to YES. The current controller Parameter settings are stored as Factory default.
WARNING: original factory settings are overwritten.

column17:
"no (normally open)"associated functionality is activated when “DI1” port is short circuit. The associated function is deactivated when “DI1” port is open circuit.
"nc (normally closed)"associated functionality is activated when “DI1” port is open circuit and deactivated
when “DI1” port is short circuit
column18:
"no (normally open)"associated functionality is activated when “DI1” port is short circuit. The associated function is deactivated when “DI1” port is open circuit.
"nc (normally closed)"associated functionality is activated when “DI1” port is open circuit and deactivated
when “DI1” port is short circuit
